{"entries":[{"title":"UK Bribery Act Amendment 2025‑03","link":"https://www.gov.uk/uk-bribery-amendment-2025-03.pdf","published":"2025-03-12","summary":"Amendment introduces stricter limits on hospitality and new approval requirements for third‑party agents."}]}
Parsing the amendment document to extract its clause structure.

arguments.content:
# UK Bribery Act Amendment 2025‑03

## Clause 4.1
All agents must obtain written approval before offering any hospitality exceeding £100.

## Clause 7.2
Financial transactions over £5,000 require senior sign‑off and documented justification.

## Clause 9.4
Enhanced record‑keeping: any gift or benefit above £50 must be logged in the central anti‑bribery register within 5 business days.

*Effective date: 1 July 2025*

arguments.title: UK Bribery Act Amendment 2025‑03 – Action Required
arguments.body:
## Summary
The amendment introduces stricter hospitality limits, higher‑value transaction approvals, and faster gift‑recording deadlines. All align with existing controls AC‑001, AC‑003, AC‑004.

## Recommended Actions
1. Update the Hospitality Policy to reflect the £100 approval threshold.
2. Communicate the new senior sign‑off requirement for transactions >£5,000 to Finance.
3. Adjust the anti‑bribery register process to capture gifts within 5 days.

*Effective 1 July 2025.*

messages.content: Alert dispatched via email to compliance@company.com, finance@company.com, hr@company.com.
Storing the amendment record in the compliance database for audit purposes.
